document.discussion_title: Today's Best Country and Your All Time Favorites :: NSUARB hearing in Truro on CCRSB's proposal to adjust boundaries of its electoral districts :: Local News - Story
document.topic_text: NSUARB hearing in Truro on CCRSB's proposal to adjust boundaries of its electoral districts 8/22/2016 The Nova Scotia Utility and Review Board is holding a hearing in Truro on the local school board's application to confirm the boundaries of its electoral districts. The province's Education Act requires the Chignecto-Central Regional School Board to apply to the UARB every eight years to confirm or change the number of district-elected school board members and the boundaries of the electoral districts. Back in June, the UARB approved the school board's request to retain its current structure of 15 district-elected board members, plus a regionally-elected African-Nova Scotian member and a provincially appointed First Nations member. The school board is proposing some changes to the electoral boundaries, based on changes in a number of local municipalities and counties and voter parity. Monday's hearing starts at 10 a.m. at the school board office on Lorne Street. You can find more information on the school board's proposal here: http://www.ccrsb.ca/sites/default/files/CCRSB-Proposed-Electoral-Districts-Scenario-2.pdf
